children.value: In this post we will walk through the process of deploying a Gatsby blog to Microsoft Azure Storage using VS Code.
To complete this tutorial you will need the following tools:
Node - To run the rest of the tools
Gatsby CLI - To create your blazingly fast blog!
VS Code - as a code editor
and check itâ€™s installed by checking the version from your terminal.

$ node -v
$ v10.9.0
Next, we can install the important part!

$ npm install --global gatsby-cli
+ gatsby-cli@2.4.2
updated 1 package in 4.868s
Next you will create the blog from the handy
If you already have a site you want to deploy, skip forwards to

$ npx gatsby new azure-blog https://github.com/gatsbyjs/gatsby-starter-blog

info Creating new site from git: https://github.com/gatsbyjs/gatsby-starter-blog.git
Cloning into 'azure-blog'...
remote: Enumerating objects: 1, done.
remote: Counting objects: 100% (1/1), done.
remote: Total 1139 (delta 0), reused 0 (delta 0), pack-reused 1138
Receiving objects: 100% (1139/1139), 2.14 MiB | 2.95 MiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (636/636), done.
success Created starter directory layout
info Installing packages...
...
You can now view your website by running

$ cd azure-blog
$ npm run develop
You should now see your blog in the flesh!
Microsoft Azure is a cloud hosting provider which offers a wide range of tools and services. Today you are going to use Azure Storage to host our static Gatsby blog.
If you donâ€™t have an Azure account,
for a free 30 day account with

Note: You will need to verify your identity with a credit card, but will not be charged unless you begin to use paid service and exceed the free allowance. The cost per GB for storage is in the region of Â£0.04 so it should last a while.
As part of this tutorial you will:
Create a production build of your blog

properties.aria-label: create a production gatsby build permalink

children.value: You are now ready to produce a production build of your blog. Make sure youâ€™re in the blog folder and then run.

$ gatsby build

properties.aria-label: install the azure storage extension permalink

children.value: The easiest way to deploy your blog to your storage account is to use the
Install the Azure Storage Extension - Extensions Gallery
Alternatively, select the extension option from VS Code and search for
Now you can finally deploy your blog!
folder in VS code and select
If you havenâ€™t logged in before, this will show you a prompt in VS Code where you will need to select
You will see a dialog in the bottom right, asking you to load a webpage and enter a device code. Click on
The webpage should show you are trying to link your Azure device to VS Code, click
and login to Azure if you werenâ€™t already.
If everything worked correctly you should see a page confirming you signed in.
You can now return to VS Code and select your subscription and then your storage account.
Selecting the storage account will begin the deployment.
If you have previously deployed you will see a dialog asking if you want to delete your files and redeploy.
In a few seconds, you will see a message in the bottom right of VS Code confirming that your blog has been deployed!
Congratulations! Youâ€™ve successfully completed the tutorial and deployed your Gatsby blog to Azure!
